Datatable.LocalizationPair: Endless Space 2: Penumbra

Endless Space 2's third expansion brings the wraith-like outsiders, the Umbral Choir, to the Endless galaxy as well as a brand-new gameplay system: Hacking. Spy on your enemies, engage in devious counter-espionage, and decide whether the Umbral Choir should come into the light or remain in the shadows!

An ancient, wraith-like creature who trawled the darkest recesses of the cosmos, the Umbral Choir was drawn to the Endless galaxy upon hearing the anguished cries of a galaxy in pain. Keeping to the safety of the shadows, the Umbral Choir must resolve the fundamental rift in its nature, while choosing the best course for those who suffer.

Endless Space 2: Penumbra introduces the Umbral Choir Major Faction and brand-new Hacking gameplay mechanics available to all factions.
Content: - Community-inspired Umbral Choir major civilization - Umbral Choir ships - Five new Heroes, incl. the Pilgrim, Imane Kryv - Umbral Choir faction Quest - Hacking gameplay - Cloaked ships - Other shadowy stuff!

Hacking Console
Defensive Programming

Click to open a menu for selecting and placing a Defensive Program on a system. Defensive Programs can be placed on any colonized System you own; they will announce a Security Breach and apply their effect if an enemy Hacking Op reaches your system. They can be cancelled at any time by right-clicking their Bandwith allocation in the upper left corner of the Scan View.
Hacking Operation Control

Click to enter Hacking Mode. This allows you to draw the path of your next Hacking Op, then launch it. To draw a path, select a starting Node then a target Node. The Hacking Op will choose the shortest path, but you can select any number of Nodes in between them as Waypoints. You can cancel a Hacking Op by right clicking it in the Hacking Operations list in the upper left corner of the Scan View Screen. Be careful, losing your starting Node will automatically cancel the Hacking Op.
Offensive Programming

Click to open a menu allowing to select and place an offensive Program on a system Offensive Programs can be placed on enemy colonized star system and their effect will start at the beginning of the next turn. They can also be placed preemptively on the path of a hacking operation. Their effect will start the turn after the hacking operation has reached them. Offensive program cannot be cancelled. They will stop when the hacking operation they are linked to is over.

Sleepers are unwitting spies for your empire set up on enemy systems through Hacking Ops. They will grant you Vision on the system they are on, and can steal Resources if there are enough of them in an enemy empire.

This is the basic distance per Turn that a Hacking Op advances from its current position towards the target node. It can be affected by Improvements, Population bonuses, Laws, etc.
Tracing Speed: {0}
This is the basic distance per Turn that a Trace advances from its current position towards the target node. It can be affected by Improvements, Population bonuses, Laws, etc.
Topple Government
By flooding the infosphere with scandalous, malicious, or simply false news stories, governments can be destabilised, and ultimately overthrown.
Cause Anarchy and change the government of the other empire
Scramble Navigation
Interfering with the automated protocols that identify vessels' interstellar location causes the cessation of all fleet movement.
Prevent all fleet movement for $(Duration)[turn]
Support Revolutionaries
Meddling with local security forces' abilities to watch, track, and anticipate revolutionary groups' actions enables internal dissension.
Uses the populations of the Systems to spawn pirate invasion Fleets
Install Regime
By infiltrating identification databases, critical personnel can be easily deposed and replaced, leading to a simple transfer of power.
Steal the system
Server ID Duplication
Access to a broad range of engineering, research, and patent file systems permits the theft of sensitive technological knowledge.
Steal a technology
Injure Figurehead
By manipulating urban infrastructure like self-driving vehicles, smart buildings, or even autonomous machines, Academy Heroes can be wounded, reducing their effectiveness.
Wound the system's Hero
Install Transmigration Beacon

Transmigration Beacons are a destructive but effective means of moving your main system at short notice. Placed on Special Nodes, the Beacons act as a special receiver for high-entropic digital snapshots that allow the relocation of the entire system--with a cost to population and infrastructure if they're not fully charged.
Create a Transmigration Beacon, allocating {0}[processingPower] in the process.
Jam Commands
Creating confusion in the comms systems used to deploy ground forces is a great means of generating chaos in the enemy's battle plans.
Force the target to use a unique detrimental Ground Battle Play as Defense on this system for $(Duration)[turn]
Infiltrate Scanners
By hacking into enemy fleet sensor systems, electromagnetic or otherwise, a more complete image of the galaxy can be established.
Grants vision on all fleets for $(Duration)[turn]
Influence Politics
Engineering various minor catastrophes--economic, scientific, or religious, as needed--via computer networks is an excellent means of altering the political outlook of a system's population.
Force the system's politics to change to a selected Political Party
Improve Image
Through a mix of careful adjustments to internal diplomatic communiqués, combined with subtle propaganda programs, faction relations can be improved.
Improve your relations with the faction ($(Duration)[turn])
Impersonate Ambassador

One amusing way to strain relations between major and minor civilizations in the galaxy is to create the persona of a fake ambassador who is insulting, commits social faux-pas, and involves themselves in dubious enterprises.
Reduce by 5 the Minor Civilization's relations with its suzerain ($(Duration)[turn])
Uncover Secrets
Focusing on discovering the dirty little secrets of a Minor Civilization's decision-makers gives significant leverage, reducing the cost of diplomatic actions.
Hack Economy
By massaging bank data, manipulating exchange rates, and tweaking invoices, the economies of Minor Civilizations can be accelerated (until someone figures it out).

Increase the Minor Civilization's yield by 75% for normal Resources and by 50% for Strategic Resources and Luxuries. The Minor Civilization will grant Relation Rewards even when at war or in a neutral relationship. ($(Duration)[turn])
Sabotage Supplies
Even pirate rings need good logistics, and this operation causes chaos in the supply lines via false requests, faked manifests, and general misinformation.
Falsify Logs
Pirates don't tend to live in the past, so by hacking their logs and adding a different spin on past encounters, it isn't too difficult to engineer better relations.
Improve your relations with the Pirates
Eavesdrop
By hacking into pirate HR systems (even pirates have bureaucracies), information on the chain of command and personal relationships can be gathered, reducing diplomactic costs.
Hack Autodroids
Every pirate leaves much of the--literally--heavy lifting of plunder to automated machines, which gives a perfect opportunity to easily pilfer a few bits and pieces.
Steal some of the Pirate Lair's resources

Create Sanctuary
Deploying special self-replicating machines that can achieve a limited form of autonomy and communal development in most biomes, this program allows a hidden foothold to be established in the system.

Create a Sanctuary on a planet
Sanctuary Systems also offer the same bonuses as Backdoors for Hacking Ops.
Destroy Sanctuary
Deliver a critical-infrastructure virus into the coding of the enemy's Sanctuary, causing terminal damage.
Destroy one of the Sanctuaries on this node
Blackout
Overload all the system's interstellar signal-processing infrastructure, cutting it off from the rest of the galaxy for a short time.
Blackmail
By threatening to expose the hacker's meddling in other empires' digital systems, a great deal of pressure can be placed on the enemy.
Destroy Backdoor
A specially tailored virus will target and destroy the enemy Backdoor hack, preventing them from launching further hacking operations from this location.
Destroy the Backdoor on this node
Shutdown Hack
Pirates and small galactic players often employ dated or lax security routines, allowing their traced hacking operations to be easily nullified.
Cancel the Pirate or Minor Faction's traced Hacking Operation
Stand Down
Sometimes the smartest move is not to make a move, but observe and wait.
Create Backdoor
Backdoors can be hidden in a range of networked infrastuctures, but most often target widespread, critical systems with many layers of legacy code such as power, medical, or transportation grids.
Create a hidden Backdoor which allows new Hacking Operations from this node and grants increased Hacking speed on neighboring nodes.
Embed Sleeper
By employing hacks of various computer or cybernetic systems that citizens interact with on a daily basis, a sizeable group of individuals can become unwitting agents of your empire.
One Population [populationUncolored] will become an unwitting Sleeper [traitor] for your cause on this System. They will give you vision and economic bonuses until they are killed.
Abduct Sleeper

The highest honor for any unwitting population of Sleeper agents is to be chosen to be abducted to become an Umbral Shadow and be placed at the heart of the empire. Their dedication will always be remembered.
One Sleeper [traitor] of this system will become an Umbral Shadow [populationUncolored] on {0}.
One Sleeper [traitor] of this system will become {0} (cannot spawn Umbral Shadow on {1}).

{0} of your Sleepers [traitor] in this empire's Systems will be removed, and one unit of Population will become an {1} Umbral Shadow [populationUncolored] on {2}.
Excess [traitor] will be turned into {0}.
Reclaim Home
As you are intimately familiar with the strengths and weaknesses of the networked infrastructure of your old home, it is much easier to deploy a large-scale cyberattack to wrest back control.
Recover full control of your lost Home System.
The effects of this outcome will only be applied once "First Contact" is made with this Minor Civilization
Effect Level
The Hacking empire will not be able to refuse your next Contextual Term.
Accelerator
Diverting part of your Bandwidth to the networks used for this hack will allow them to work more efficiently, or at least sort out kitten pictures much faster.
Piggyback
Piggyback on the existing infrastructure located at this node--natural or artificial--to reduce the Bandwidth costs of any offensive programs used in this operation.
Divert
Discovered a more pressing target for your hack? No problem. Use this program to change the target of your Hacking Operation.
Overload
Flooding the target node's networks with undecipherable noise means the Bandwidth cost of defender's programs escalates, causing widespread data and communication errors.
Blackout the system for $(Duration)[turn]
Lockdown

Who wants an enemy snooping on their systems? With this Lockdown program in operation, hackers will be prevented from setting up Backdoors on the node on which it is placed as well as others further down the hacking path.
Encrypt
Raising encryption standards on the system causes the progress of enemy hacking operations passing through the node to slow down and their technicians to cry.
Interrogate
Bombarding incoming packets with queries causes the Bandwidth costs of enemy hacking operations passing through the node to increase.
Firewall
A firewall set up in front-line system infrastructure will block most attacks and cause the weakest ones to not even function.
Track
Passive snooping on data transmissions helps uncover the visible progress of any enemy hacking operations past the node on which this program is placed.
Operation Cancellation
After investing time and resources to create something, it's only natural that it takes time and resources to pack up while keeping your opponents in the dark. Hacking operations are no exception.
Backdoor

An entry point into the enemy's networks, Backdoors permit hacking operations to be launched from the node in question, and, in addition, siphon off valuable Bandwidth. Be warned, though, they are vulnerable and can be destroyed.
{0}'s Backdoor

Most displeasingly, the {0} Empire has established a Backdoor here, allowing them to launch further hacking operations from this system. It is recommended that you initiate a defensive measure to remove it, preferably yesterday.
Minor Accelerator
Diverting part of your Bandwidth to the networks used for this hack will allow them to work more efficiently.
Minor Overload
By flooding the target of your hack, you can cause congestions and cause everything to be more expensive, tedious, or complex.
Minor Encrypt
You can complexify data processing on a system, slowing the progress of enemy hacking operations to slow down and frustrating their spymasters.
Minor Interrogate
Bombarding incoming packets with queries causes the Bandwidth costs of enemy hacking operations passing through the node to increase.
Pirate Accelerator
Diverting part of your Bandwidth to the networks used for this hack will allow them to work more efficiently, or at get all the celebrity gossip more quickly.
Pirate Overload
By flooding the target of your hack, you can cause congestions and cause everything to be more costly in time and processing power.
Pirate Encrypt
You can hide packet mishandlers on a system, forcing enemy hacking operations to use time-consuming verification programs.
Pirate Interrogate
Bombarding incoming packets with queries causes the Bandwidth costs of enemy hacking operations passing through the node to increase.

Immaterial Population

Dark Matter Manipulators

Organic Network

Twitch Infiltrators

Umbral Choir

An ancient immaterial creature from the depth of intergalactic space, the Umbral Choir roamed the cold, empty wastes, terribly alone until a great cry of anguish pierced the darkness. Shattering into a choir of echoes, the fractured creature sped towards the source of the space-and-time rending wail--the Endless galaxy--seeking to salve that which was in pain. Unbeknownst to the Umbral Choir, the cry marked the dying scream of the Endless civilization, and as it arrived, millenia later, new life was emerging from the remnants. Still wishing to give peace to any who suffer, the Umbral Choir will remain in the shadows, infiltrating and watching until its is ready to act.
Kalmat

Evolving on a volcanically-active planet, the tardigrade-like Kalmat rose to sentience while descending into the depths. Great eruptions spewed vast toxic plumes into the atmosphere, rendering the surface uninhabitable for all except the most robust of life, and like many, the Kalmat battled violently for sanctuary in the earth. With ruptures still dangerous, survival became a matter of evacuating underground settlements rapidly, and the Kalmat developed sophisticated monitoring and communication abilities. Allied with advances in materials science, the Kalmat became masters of machine learning, often integrating cybernetics into their physical forms. Today, knowing their future will always be tenuous on such a homeworld, they are setting off for the stars.
In the Shadows

An immaterial creature from the depths of space, the Umbral Choir roams the galaxy from its single, hidden system, Nexus, but can also establish Sanctuaries to watch other lifeforms even more closely. In the event of a catastrophe, the Choir can transmigrate Nexus to another system.
A Symphony of Anguish

A traveller of the wider cosmos, the Umbral Choir was drawn to the Endless galaxy when it heard a chorus of suffering coming from the stars therein. Curious to learn and heal, it watches from the darkest places, attempting to make peace with its own new, discordant nature.
Kalmat
A rugged, resilient species, the Kalmat are masters of survival and cybernetics.

Possesses a hidden Home System, located on a special node, that can be migrated to another special node for a cost. Cannot colonize Systems in the normal fashion, but is able to place hidden Sanctuaries on planets. Can abduct Sleeper agents from enemy populations to bring them back to the Home System as enhanced populations. Umbral Choir are immune to influence conversion; however their ships can be attacked in Cold War even when on their Home System.

Sila Minor

A harmony of the Umbral Choir that found itself exploring the supernovaed shell of a spent star, Sila would've remained a resonating echo of the whole if not for coming across the husk of a long-dead Lost. Seared by the trapped Dust, Sila experienced a severing from the mind gestalt, as well as a partial manifestation into the physical realm. Overwhelmed, but heightened to the sensitivities of the galaxy's currents of Dust, Sila discovered the shattered Harrow system, where it watched the machinations of Isyander and his Academy. Not the only one watching though, Sila was first ensnared before proving its innocence to Anaxagoras and Ay Seer 1.2Gado, after which it was given license to roam and learn on behalf of the Academy.
Fasol Staccato

A gentle echo in the majesty which is the symphony of the Umbral Choir, Fasol's sundering from the overmind came when it infiltrated a Craver warship as it undertook a hyperspace jump. Alone in the hive-like network of the vessel's central nervous system, Fasol was terrified on two distinct planes. First, the wrenching, disorienting separation from its collective, but secondly, being in the presence of such a species of ceaseless violence. Most likely Fasol would've perished, but for the Craver's cargo--a vital stock of Dust that permeated into the wraith's ethereal form, transforming it into a cognitive powerhouse. Somehow, with a potent message of peace, Fasol flipped the Craver crew from insatiable warfarers to committed pacifists. While Fasol continues its mission of non-violence, the Craver vessel is rumored to have found sanctuary on a Pilgrim research world.
Lare Fermata

If there was any echo which might've been suspected to harbor desires of emancipation and independence from the Umbral Choir collective, Lare would've been a good bet. A refrain with aggressive tendencies, during the Choir's early forays through the galaxy, Lare often infiltrated other species' logical systems in a manner that frequently led to fear and conflict (one example being the Rydha Skirmish between Horatio and Choir fleets, leading to the Horatio Commander's famous words: "Monsters from other realms do exist--and they must be beautified!"). Lare's freedom arrived after it annihilated a Hissho Kestrel-class vessel carrying Endless Dust relics.
Miredo Sharp

Miredo's liberation from the Umbral Choir collective came during a clandestine visit to the Sophon homeworld, Hekim. Unbeknownst to the Choir, infiltrating the Sophon's primary computer network put Miredo figuratively face-to-face with the galaxy's most sophisticated AI, ENFER. Inside ENFER's silicon citadel, a tremendous battle of wits ensued encompassing logic, physics, and theology. Miredo eventually lost, and might've been consigned to the digital trash, but for ENFER's mercy. Admiring the wraith's diverse talents, ENFER felt the galaxy would be a lesser place without the deep thinker and set it free from the mind gestalt through a controlled exposure to Dust.
Imane Kryv

A descendent of the great Kryv family line, Imane grew up constantly reminded of the accomplishments of her famous forebears, most notably Deona Kryv, one of the Pilgrim's original founders. A contrarian by heart, Imane rebuffed the expectations that came with her name, and spurned her political connections. Instead, she headed for the fringes of Pilgrim space, where she pursued unlikely Endless relics with a cast of eccentric or washed-up adventurers. Even here, away from the piety of the Pilgrim's inner worlds, she still found her faith tested, and increasingly experimented with cybernetic augmentations in an effort to discover meaning in her life. Although she didn't know it at the time, the most significant event in her life came when she made first contact with the intergalactic creature known as the Umbral Choir.

Infiltration Engine
Simplifying hacking protocols permits additional, speedier hacking operations.
Hacking Optimisation
Running hacking code through neural networks gives greater efficiencies in both speed and number of hacking operations.
Enhanced Anti-Cloaking Probe
Upgraded with a full-suite of radiation-tracking technology, probes can now detect cloaked vessels and structures employing secondary level cloaking tech.
Elite Anti-Cloaking Probe
Fully enhanced with the latest neutrino-emission detectors, even the most carefully disguised vessels employing tertiary-level cloaking tech can be discovered.
Enhanced Cloaking
By using a specially designed nano-skin, shipbuilding docks across the empire can mask fleets' thermal emissions, raising cloaking tech to the secondary level.
Elite Cloaking
Employing anti-particle scrubbing tech in conjunction with nano-skins, the empire's fleets can enjoy tertiary-level cloaking.
Galactic Belonging
Knowing Umbral Choir echoes are creating homes across the galaxy in far-flung sanctuaries gives an increased sense of harmony to the echoes of Nexus.

Intrinsic Connection
The Umbral Choir being a single entity, it's natural for it to connect to its more distant worlds; however, it has no notion of decentralized organization and as such, handles trade in its own way.

Can only build one HQ on the Home System, and can only own one Trading Company. Subsidiaries are created automatically on all the Sanctuaries. Trade agreements will trace routes to discovered Sanctuaries for friendly players.
Reinforced Connection
By learning to focus more intently in several places at one, the Umbral Choir manages to more efficiently manage its trade and overcome its economic shortcomings.
+$(Input) [dustColored] per Company Level on Trade Company income
Sleeper Cull
Unleashing a bespoke high-frequency 'pulse' across the entire system causes massive, terminal cerebral damage to all hacked populations.
Unlock the Sleeper Cull System Action: Eliminate all Sleepers [traitor] on System
Sleeper Identification
A system-wide, mandatory software update for all citizens' networked tech, permits the temporary identification of all hacked populations.
Unlock the Sleeper Identification System Action: Reveal Sleepers [traitor] on the System for a few turns
Sleeper Liquidation
In the unfortunate circumstance when the Nexus home system is fully occupied, this facility allows Sleepers abducted from far-flung places to reach their full, material, potential.
Doubles the Resources gained when trying to convert a Sleeper [traitor] into an Umbral Shadow when there is no available slot for it on the Home System
Hyperlight Acceleration
Advances in the understanding of the vacuum's quantum "froth" underpin starflight engines that can achieve greater accelerations at super-lightspeeds.
Unlock Level 2 Upgrade
Unlock Level 3 Upgrade
Unlock Level 4 Upgrade
Habitable Anomalies
Utilising the potential of naturally-occuring anomalies, this facilty enables Umbral Choir populations to inhabit some of the system's toughest environments.
Lunar Suburbs
Contrary to appearances, the daily moon-to-planet commute is still shorter than that of the capital's inhabitants.
Extremophile Research
Umbral Choir echoes curious about system anomalies can protect themselves from damaging effects, and secure both Dust and knowledge.
Profitable Ventures
Umbral Choir markets beyond the usual bounds of more materially-minded species, means companies can enjoy better Dust revenues, especially in the luxury-end of the market.
Immaterial Connection
Permeating the higher atmosphere of gas planets becomes much easier for the Umbral Choir, and as such it can study more precisely their behaviour and composition.
Pocket Laboratory

Being inhospitable places, many facets of gas planets are still badly understood. However, with citizens carrying pocket-sized labs that can analyse myriad physical conditions, comprehension is improving.
Elevation of the Integrated
Through complex and regular ceremonies, the Umbral Choir integrates even better the activated Sleepers living among itself, resulting in more harmony, as well as increased productivity.
Subterranean Sanctuary
Extending Umbral Choir sanctuaries deep into the crust of the host planet allows higher population thresholds.
Deep Atmosphere Habitats
Pressures deep into the thick atmospheres of gas giants can reach spine-crushing levels, but with these robust, but somewhat small, habitats those who enjoy bijou apartments can thrive.
Phased Cloths
The use of advanced phased magnetics systems when upgrading Vodyani Cloth brings boosts in speed and efficiency to both workers and managers.
Microstasis Motors
Thanks to phased magnetics, the storage and transportation of perishable goods can be done by smaller and cheaper stasis systems. This means that more food can be made with less labor.
Micro Domiciles
Utilizing the latest thinking in living-space ergonomics, Umbral Choir crescents can support even denser population demographics.
Wraith Compression
If you can't construct larger habitation cresecents, then the answer is surely shrinking existing populations! That's exactly what this facility does, allowing larger populations.
Dust Bonanza
Money doesn't grow on trees, but it turns out that--in some special circumstances--Dust does materialize in weird atmospheric conditions.
School of Geniuses
The elimination of anomalous conditions provides the perfect environment for the discovery--and nurture--of pocket-sized geniuses.
Shadow Agency
A specialized Umbral Choir espionage agency, this institution works to hamper enemy hacking operations and sway popular opinion.
Industrial Refrains
Dedicating Umbral Choir echoes to the question of manufacturing efficiencies elevates industrial production on crescents and sanctuaries.
Logic-assisted Industry
By examining industrial pipelines with a logician's eye, the Umbral Choir can improve industrial production on crescents and sanctuaries.
Interstitial Sciences
An institute solely focused on the interplay between the material and shadow universes brings great scientific boons to Umbral Choir crescents and sanctuaries.
Cyber Farm
Traditional food staples are altered on the genetic level to provide sustenance more suited to recently manifested Umbral Choir wraiths.
Digital Aquaponics
Applying sophisticated efficiency algorithms to aquaponic sites leads to increased yields.
Shadow Garden
Even manifested in the galaxy, Umbral Choir wraiths continue to need dark matter infusions, and this specialist grove offers such produce.
Wraith Orchard
An esoteric forest of natural dark matter "trees", Umbral Choir wraiths can come here and gain sustenance from the ambient radiance.
Stampede

Chapter 1 - A Cry of Anguish - Part 1

Imane Kryv
What happened to me today? I was out in deep space, alone, chasing up some tenuous Endless relic leads from command, when I came across… I don't know…something. I can't recall anything about it. All I remember is that I felt a kind of cosmic awe, but then I got afraid--terrified, in truth. When I listen back to my exchanges with command I get goose bumps at how scared I sound. The worst thing, though, is hearing myself say I must've been dreaming. I don't sound…myself. Maybe I've been out here too long. Maybe it's time I stop hunting Endless relics. Maybe it's time I renounced my faith.
- - - - - - - - - - -
Umbral Choir
We came to offer solace, but the first offshoot of the Pilgrim organism reacted to our presence with horror. We infiltrated its cybernetic systems, hid our existence so we might buy time to consider our next move.
Now we watch the offshoot proceed onwards into the barren depths of this ancient galaxy, no sign of how it is controlled by the over-gestalt. We know the Pilgrim organism craves to locate artefacts of a long dead race. Perhaps we can help?
Elsewhere, we feel other organisms trembling with pain and conflict, overwhelming us. We shall not have harmony until this galaxy stills, but the way forward is unclear.
Do we stay in the shadows or come into the light?
Unveil
We should make our first encounter, begin our mission of peace.
Purge or Assimilate a Minor Faction
Purge (or Assimilate) the Minor Civilization through the actions on the Minor Faction Diplomacy screen

Like the Pilgrim, the new creature is a curious organism. How it organizes its myriad parts into a cohesive, purposeful whole is a mystery. Many parts have fled for unknown reasons. In truth, it seems afraid of us; it offers precious materials as if to appease us.
Hide
We must learn more of this galaxy from the shadows.
Discover $SystemObjectiveAmountName more Systems
You will need exploration ships and probes to do this.
We are awed by this galaxy. Diverse worlds, diverse flora. An oasis of life in a desert of death. Most wondrous of all, we've found clusters of a miraculous substance with incredible potential. Dust.
Chapter 1 - A Cry of Anguish - Part 2

Imane Kryv
I started to see it in my dreams. Now every time I close my eyes I see it too. It's alien...intangible...monstrous. A tangle of wraith-like limbs, writhing and expanding, getting ever closer, unrestrained by our reality, the notions of inside and outside meaningless to it. It snakes closer still, pauses, like it's studying me, and then it makes contact...I think...I think it's inside me somehow...watching...waiting. The waiting is the worst thing. The Endless relics mean nothing to me now. I fantasize about burning up in the nearest star and ending my horror.
- - - - - - - -
Umbral Choir
We reach out to the organisms of this galaxy, but the controlling mind-gestalts remain silent, only interacting with their isolated puppets. These offshoots react to us with terror, unable to understand that we only wish to commune and cure this galaxy's suffering. And denied harmony without, we will remain fractured within...
The Pilgrim offshoot exhibits baffling behavior. We know the Pilgrim organism seeks relics of a long-dead civilization, but this offshoot acts erratically, circling supergiants, Then suddenly breaking off and drifting through interstellar space. Is it damaged? Corrupted?
What are we missing?
Prepare
The Choir grows more discordant as the galaxy stirs. We must grow more united.
Produce $InfluenceObjectiveAmountName [prestigeColored] per turn
Influence can be increased through specialized Improvements, Hero Skills, and Luxury Resources

We are not the single, harmonious entity we once were, but the myriad echoes of the Choir are at least concordant. Now we must use this unity to be brave, and make real connections with this galaxy's life.
Chapter 1 - A Cry of Anguish - Part 2

Imane Kryv
I started to see it in my dreams. Now every time I close my eyes I see it too. It's alien...intangible...monstrous. A tangle of wraith-like limbs, writhing and expanding, getting ever closer, unrestrained by our reality, the notions of inside and outside meaningless to it. It snakes closer still, pauses, like it's studying me, and then it makes contact...I think...I think it's inside me somehow...watching...waiting. The waiting is the worst thing. The Endless relics mean nothing to me now. I fantasize about burning up in the nearest star and ending my horror.
- - - - - - - -
Umbral Choir
We discover more organisms.
They create such intricate, delicate worlds, it is hard to fathom how single, unified minds can orchestrate such beautiful chaos. No matter how hard we look--how many systems we infiltrate, how many sanctuaries we create--we cannot locate the over-gestalts. We yearn for our own fractured existence to be healed, but the pain of this galaxy keeps us splintered. Only when we find the over-gestalts will we make progress...and we fear until then the mindless offshoots will always react to us with terror...
The Pilgrim offshoot exhibits baffling behavior. We know the Pilgrim organism seeks relics of a long-dead civilization, but this offshoot acts erratically, circling supergiants, then suddenly breaking off and drifting through interstellar space. Is it damaged? Corrupted?
What are we missing?
Prepare
Only through more careful examination will we understand--and cure--the life of this galaxy.
Reach $MaxBandwidthObjectiveAmountName maximum [processingPower]
Maximum Bandwidth can be increased by getting Sleepers for instance
Our capacity for infiltration has never been stronger. Our knowledge of the power of Dust never greater. We are close now; close to a true understanding of the life of this galaxy.
Chapter 2 - The Dawning Light

Imane Kryv
I found it! I knew something had got inside my head that day, and I was right! The seventh time I ran full diagnostics on my cybernetics I picked up something I hadn't noticed before. A tiny digital thread, but one that when I grabbed it and pulled, the entire tapestry revealed itself.
It's not a monster.
It's adrift...broken...confused.
I think I can help this thing.
- - - - - - - -
Umbral Choir
We've been blind to the truth.
All this time we've labored under the illusion that the organisms of this galaxy are just like us. Whole, indivisible, ubiquitous.
They aren't.
Unlike the echoes of the choir, the offshoots aren't simple reverberations of a mind-gestalt. They are their own independent, conscious entities, each with a purpose, each with a life that binds tight to some and loose to others. No wonder their worlds are so complex, their civilizations so chaotic! The pain we feel isn't the suffering of a couple of dozen organisms; it's the pain of billions.
The Pilgrim offshoot's self-examinations led to this revelation. Her name is Imane Kryv, and she carries a dark burden, black as the blackest singularity.
We fear we might never salve such pain, never regain our own harmony. But we have a chance to begin.
Enlist
Imane can be a bridge--between us and the other races. She might suffer now, but if she joins us we can alleviate that pain.
Inhabit $SystemObjectiveAmountName Systems
You can inhabit a System by creating a Sanctuary (or an Outpost or Colony if those are available)
I see the Umbral Choir in all its majesty now. It is not a monster. It is a savior. From now on, I will dedicate myself to it wholly, and be an instrument of its designs for serenity.
Unburden
For something in such pain, an absence of existence is better than an existence of suffering. We should end Imane.
Hack through $TargetSpecialNodeName
To hack through a node, go to Scan View and set a Hacking Operation passing through or ending on this node, then wait for the node to be completely hacked
Imane suffers no longer. From now on, we will seek the courage to relieve others in pain. Let this be our mantra.
Hack through $SpawnedSystemName
Chapter 3 - The Thing

It came from the depths of space. Ancient, formless, whole. It wasn't seeking us, wasn't seeking life, but it heard us and came.
It wanted to ease our suffering; Pilgrim, Sophon, even Craver, whoever, but it mistook our nature. We aren't alike, ourselves, and this thing, the Umbral Choir. We are multitudes, all striving for something different, while it is one refrain--presently shattered, but still one refrain. And I don't know if this galaxy with its legion souls can ever be harmonious like the Umbral Choir once was. Maybe war is inevitable.
I will help it though. More than anything I want serenity to reign here. There is a quandry though...
I've found peace--comfort even--in the echo that journeys with me. I feel the whole in the part, but I also feel something else: a dissatisfaction; a craving; a budding kernel of self. Knowing the nature of the species of this galaxy has awakened something in the Umbral Choir. A contradiction. It desires harmony, reunification, but every refrain also wants to be free.
The Choir trusts me--seeks my counsel in all matters.
What course should I secretly plot for it though? Does the galaxy need an exemplar of unity, or is individual freedom--no matter the cost--the highest ideal?
Harmony
Orchestrator Solmire Prima needs the military might to quash any internal uprisings.
Create a Ship of $OffensivePowerObjectiveAmountName [offensiveMilitaryPower]
Add Offensive Modules to a Ship Design to increase its Offensive Power

I feel my echo's hunger to cleave itself from the collective waning as Solmire Prima flexes its military power. I am convinced the Choir will soon no longer be a chorus of voices, but the single, unified creature it once was.
Freedom
A contact, Belzah Rach, can help with the echoes' dreams of emancipation.
Get a Cloaked Fleet to $TargetSystemName
If necessary, to cloak a Fleet, add a Cloaking module to one of its ships and utilise the "Cloak" Fleet Action

The Endless, Belzah Rach, possesses a brilliant mind, full of ideas and compassion--and history. Ironic that I learn more about the Endless in a matter of days with Belzah, than in a lifetime of study and piety with the Pilgrims. Now we must take the final step for the Choir to become a true people.
Chapter 3 - The Things

Imane is gone, forever at peace.
Out of all the offshoots--no, individuals--we've infiltrated in this strange galaxy, she was the first and the one we came to know best. We knew how she talked to her species-mates, how she liked the solitude of deep space, even her taste in discordant soundscapes. We know she no longer suffers, but still...we miss her. It remains hard to grasp that she was a creature in her own right, not just an appendage of a greater over-mind. And with that insight comes an uncomfortable, unfamiliar feeling: guilt.
There is no Pilgrim creature only Pilgrims. Millions of them--among billions of others. Each a unique star in a unique constellation, the totality of life in all its inspiring, depraved, noisy, silent, joyous, and bleak forms dizzying for us.
Like ourselves, this galaxy still needs harmony, but with a true understanding of Imane's death, we face a dilemma...
Should we shape the galaxy knowing those we influence as intimately as we can, or should we proceed from the shadows watching those myriad lives from afar? If we are going to end suffering by ending lives, is it our responsibility to bear witness to those lives, learn as much as we can about every creature's deepest hopes and fears? Or should we guide at a distance, and keep those inner lives closed to us?
Whatever we choose, we fear we will shoulder a burden.
Watch
Knowing the inner lives of the people of this galaxy is a weight we'd rather not carry. We will ease the galaxy's pain by infiltrating systems not minds.
Possess $BackdoorObjectiveAmountName Backdoors
Backdoor creation is one of the possible Hacking Outcomes of a hack targeting a System owned by another Empire.
Our espionage network has never been stronger; our ability to infiltrate our enemies never greater--or faster. Even if lives are lost, forever forgotten, we will bring tranquility to this galaxy.
Occupy
It is the most fundamental intrusion, but if we are prepared to extinguish lives we must bear witness to those lives--from the inside.
Add a Sleeper to $TargetSystemName via Hacking
Sleeper embedding is one of the possible Hacking Outcomes of a hack targeting a System owned by another Empire.

With our infiltration of $TargetSystemName's inhabitants' cybernetic systems, their most intimate thoughts are laid bare. We know how they think--and feel. Even if they might yet be extinguished, we are richer for knowing these lives.
Final Chapter - The Last Rebellion

I'm doing the right thing. I'm doing the right thing. Of course, if you have to tell yourself that every minute of every day, then maybe you aren't doing the right thing.
The Umbral Choir wanted to end all suffering--within and without. It wanted the galaxy to be at peace. It wanted itself to be whole. Noble aims. Ones that few would dispute. But if the price of peace is the elimination of life, is that too high a cost? I shudder thinking of how it might've considered snuffing me out when I was at my lowest ebb. My suffering would've ended, but I would've ended too.
Now the Umbral Choir approaches the final step in its path to wholeness. You see, a cadre of echoes who still seek to sever themselves from the mind-gestalt, have sought the aid of an Endless, Belzah Rach. They plot to shatter the Choir into unique, irreparable shards, but unfortunately--for them--their every thought and move resonates through the entire collective.
They are in the $TargetSystemName System, researching a means to achieve the shattering.
For the Choir to become one again, they must be destroyed.
This is the path I have chosen.
Crush
Until the agitator echoes are silenced, the Umbral Choir will remain broken--and maybe worse.
Take control of the $TargetSystemName System. Or just destroy it.
Don't expect them to surrender

The dissenters are gone, the Umbral Choir restored to its former incarnation, a single, crystal-clear harmony. Belzah Rach has disappeared again. Dead or back underground, I assume. I guess I won't be finding out anything more about the Endless anytime soon. So, the creature's going to need a new name. I'm angling for...The Watcher.
Final Chapter - We Are Multitudes

A galaxy of stars is greater than a single sun of the same luminousity, isn't it?
Multiplicity may not ever be able to guarantee serenity--in fact, it promises the opposite--but isn't it the only means of achieving everything we truly value? Without the other there would be no art, no love, and ultimately no renewal of life. A desire for completeness is a desire for stagnation, death, eternal darkness. At least that's what I found out alone in the depths of space.
Belzah has identified what the Umbral Choir must do to become multitudes.
The galaxy is going to lose a magnificent creature--but it is going to gain infinitely more.
I am happy to play my part.
Revolution
Belzah needs Dust. And trade will be the engine that readies the Umbral Choir for individuality.
Produce $DustObjectiveAmountName [dustColored] with your Trade Routes
Trade Route incomes can be increased by increasing their Level, getting more Subsidiaries or signing Trade Agreements

The Umbral Choir is no longer the singular--but shattered--creature that came to the galaxy, no longer a single hymn of many refrains. I mourn for its loss. More than that though, I celebrate the arrival of a million new voices, and wonder what songs they will come to sing.
Final Chapter - A Thing, Apart

We might've avoided better knowing the creatures of this galaxy, but in the resulting vacuum the presence of one death grows larger and larger.
Imane Kryv. We ended her. Ended her to eradicate her suffering, but we also ended her joy, her life, her future. This truth paralyses us, a neverending reverberation we cannot unthink.
We made a terrible mistake. One we cannot undo no matter how we go on.
It is a most strange thing for the memory of a single, virtually infinitesimal creature in an infinite cosmos to hold such power over us, but it is also an undeniable fact. Maybe all we can do now is complete the path we have chosen, before considering our place in this extraordinary galaxy.
Who deserves our service? And who deserves our scorn?
Shape
Our future here is unclear. For now, all we can do is help sculpt the galaxy into a form we can live with.
Hack a Home System
Hacking a Home System gives access to more powerful Hacking Outcomes than hacking a simple Colony
We have shaped this galaxy, but we will forever remain a thing apart. Maybe one day we will roam the cosmos again, but until then we will be no more than watchers.
Final Chapter - The Infinite Joy of Communion

This galaxy is astonishing. We came, thinking we might find a handful of star-spanning minds like our fractured self, but instead we discovered billions upon billions of smaller--but no less important--intelligences. On the whole, they concern themselves with worldly matters--their bloodkin, social relations, personal ambitions--but experiencing the visceral, turbulent emotions of their inner lives, we cannot judge that these affairs are any less significant than any greater event. We are immersed in an ocean of joys and sadnesses, hopes and fears, loves and hates, and we are richer for knowing these feelings, even if there is suffering.
We remember Imane Kryv. We remember that we ended her, but we will not let it cripple us. There are too many others to watch and nurture and provoke--and if need be, end.
We do not know what the future holds for us in this galaxy, but we do know we will stay, engrossing ourselves in more and more lives.
Know
We are no longer outsiders to this incredible galaxy. We must carry on our path of learning everything we can about our fellow minds, until we might call this home.
Possess Sleepers on $SystemTargetAmountName different Systems
The amount of Sleepers in one System doesn't matter. What's important is the amount of Systems with at least 1 Sleeper.

Life, up close and in all its dizzying abundance, is the most wondrous thing. Who knows, maybe one day the multitudes of this galaxy will inspire us to shatter ourselves completely and become like them...
What's This?

What's this? What's this? There's people everywhere. What's this? Dust floating in the air. What's this? Since some of your explorers mentioned the existence of this place named the Academy, the Umbral Choir across your Empire reached a feverish state.
Many different individuals, of different races and origins. Dust-enhanced beings, with abilities beyond the limits of their kin. A place where individuals are made even more… individual! This is nothing like what the Umbral Choir is used to.
Their voices are starting to get hysterical, almost out of tune. Something must be done.
SNEAK A PEEK

Who are you to prevent your population from achieving their dream? The only slight, small and tiny detail being that the Academy ruler may take a sudden and massive Umbral Choir arrival as a military threat. So yeah, let's do it the subtle way.
To hack through a node, go to Scan View and set a Hacking Operation passing through or ending on this node, then wait for the node to be completely hacked.

Your Umbral Choir population was so eager to get news of the Academy, they did all they could to speed up your hacking process. And now that their curiosity is satisfied, they will gladly share their newfound knowledge with your programmers.
Have a Hack passing through the Academy
SNEAK A PEEK

Who are you to prevent your population from achieving their dream? The only slight, small and tiny detail being that the Academy ruler may take a sudden and massive Umbral Choir arrival as a military threat. So yeah, let's do it the subtle way.
To Cloak a Fleet, add a Cloaking module to one of its ships and utilise the "Cloak" Fleet Action

Your Umbral Choir population was so eager to get news of the Academy, they tweaked some of your cloaking devices to boost the engines efficiency. And now that their curiosity is satisfied, they will gladly share their newfound knowledge with your engineers.
Orbit the Academy System with a Cloaked Fleet
DISTRACT
Better make the Umbral Choir focus on Heroes, rather than the Academy itself. The good thing being that you do have heroes to show them. Let's give the wraiths the parade of their lives!
You can obtain Heroes through the Marketplace or the Academy. Fleets must be in a friendly System for a Hero to be assigned.

Not only was the Umbral Choir extremely pleased with the display, it even focused their attention on the way Dust-enhanced individuals react to the void of deep space. And without waiting for your approval, they started to study this phenomenon.
Possess $AdmiralObjectiveAmountName Heroes on Fleets
OVERWHELM

An efficient way to force them to calm down could be to make your Umbral Choir population work so hard they won’t have time to think anymore. It may not be the nicest thing to do, but it sure is effective.
To hack through a node, go to Scan View and set a Hacking Operation passing through or ending on this node, then wait for the node to be completely hacked.
What you thought would be a numbing task with no real purpose turned out to be an extremely good way to train new hackers. Why not take advantage of it?

Accelerated Neuronics

Based on painstaking Pilgrim reverse-engineering of a suite of Endless artifacts discovered at a number of Endless archeological sites, this technology can assist the learning and recovery rates of sufficiently-enhanced individuals. Not suitable for normals.
Neuronic Surgery School

Capitalizing on Accelerated Neuronics tech, this specialized medical school employs state-of-the-art intracranial tools and expert surgeons to allow Dust-enhanced individuals to be further augmented with even greater perceptive abilities.
Rehabilitation Research Lab
Heroes sometimes need time for rejuvenation between postings, but that doesn't mean the process can't be improved. With Accelerated Neuronics tech supercharging recovery, downtime can be minimized!
Stochastic Formations

Analysing the movements of thousands of partially-cloaked fleets has led to a greater understanding of how individual ships can employ random, evasive movements without crashing into their fleet-mates.
Bandwidth Interferometry
Coordinating across multiple sites, universal processing capacity can be increased, with each additional installation contributing a fixed amount.
Hacking Mastery

Running succesful hacking operations requires a sophisticated level of coordination across vast regions of galactic space, making simultaneous hacks very difficult. However, with scientific advances, another parallel operation is within reach.
Peacemaker
A new doctrine of political engagement, this policy helps to both foster approval for friendly relations and make it easier for sleepers to covertly pass on scientific knowledge.
Relay Protocol
An adjustment to the algorithms that control interface handovers during hacking, means faster speeds.
Engine Masking
New means of disguising the operation of stellar drives allows cloaked fleets to attain higher speeds while still remaining hidden.
Deep Space Research
Coordinated by brilliant minds, fleets can be co-opted for scientific research into a number of vital astronomical matters.

Satellite Reengineering
A few tweaks here and there to the kernel of satellites and other space hardware allows the harvesting of extra bandwidth.
Maximized Diligence Measures Act
Overseen by a dedicated quango, this law mandates undercover operatives to help secure productivity gains in sleepers settled in the empire's most respected system.
No Idle Hands
Deep Psychological Manipulation Act
With permission to interfere in the cerebral architecture at the base of sleepers' minds, these unknowing accomplices become vocal mouthpieces for the home regime.
Influencers' Paradise
Hacking Security Act
By pilfering processor power from idle computers and devices close to every backdoor's location, galactic-wide hacking speeds can be substantially increased.
Burning Metal
Backdoor Algorithm Blackbox Directive

Governments are generally loathe to introduce "blackbox" algorithms into critical system architectures since their decision-making process cannot be rationally deconstructed. However, this law grants an exception for backdoor devices resulting in impressive reduced bandwidth costs.
Screen Doors Bill
$(Input) Bandwidth [processingPower] upkeep for [backdoor] Backdoors
$(Input) Bandwidth [processingPower] upkeep for [backdoor] Backdoors
Silent Watcher
The Umbral Choir's Home System is invisible to others; they only see a special node. And that's good news, as your Home System will remain your only "real" System for the whole game.

Your ships are also natively Cloaked, which allows you to discreetly and safely explore the galaxy. Later, Anti-Cloaking modules will allow others to detect your fleets and Home System (but stronger Cloaking measures will allow you to remain undetected).
Sanctuaries
Want to grow? Get more populations? More resources? Create Sanctuaries to leech other Planets' yields to your Home System!
Creating Sanctuaries is the Umbral Choir way of colonizing. A Sanctuary is Cloaked to other Empires who don’t have Anti-Cloaking modules. It's even possible to have a Sanctuary on a colonized Planet!
Sanctuaries can be created by hacking a neutral node with a colonizable planet. What does "Hacking" mean you ask? Well, #FFFF00#take a look at the Scan View#REVERT#!
Sanctuaries
As you can see, Sanctuaries are… peculiar. It is not possible to build Improvements, but the Home System Improvements "per planet", "per temperate"… take the Sanctuary Planets into account.

Population doesn’t grow naturally on Sanctuaries; once there is no room for new populations on the Home System, they will occupy the #FFFFFF#Sanctuary population slot#REVERT#. You can also set your Home System to send your new populations directly to a Sanctuary, through the #FFFFFF#Sanctuary Link#REVERT#.
All the #FFFFFF#resources and FIDSI produced#REVERT# by populations on Sanctuaries are transferred to the Home System.
Hacking

You can hack nodes you don’t own! Hacking allows you to disrupt your enemies. You can use it to get new Planets under your control, keep your enemies (or allies) in check, weaken them, steal their resources... And the cool thing: it’s anonymous! To start a Hack, click on the glowing #FFFF00#Hacking [hackingOperation] button#REVERT#.
Click on the #FFFFFF#starting System#REVERT# (a System you own or one with a Backdoor you own) to start a hacking route from there.

Then click on the #FFFFFF#target System#REVERT#; the Hacking Outcomes you’ll get depend on the type of System you target (Neutral, Special Node, Minor Faction, Pirate Lair, Major Faction, Home System). Keep in mind that a hack takes several turns before reaching its destination, depending on the distance.
Defensive Program

You know how to set up a Hacking Operation, now let’s see how to defend yourself from one. After all, you don't want your Fleets to be unable to move, or to let others meddle with your economy. Click on the nice #FFFF00#Defensive Program [defensiveProgram] button#REVERT# over here to get the list of available Defensive Programs.

You can click on one Defensive Program from the list to add it to a node you own. You can add/cancel them whenever you want. They all have a cost of #FFFFFF#Bandwidth (that thing over there)#REVERT# + an effect on any rival's Hacking Operation passing through the node they are on.

Bandwidth determines the maximum number of executable Programs. Each Program uses Bandwidth, and blocks that Bandwidth until the Program ends. When the Program ends, the Bandwidth is freed up and can be reused for another Program.
Migration

The grass is greener on the other side (or sometimes just safer). And if your Home System is detected by a 24CP Cravers Fleet, maybe it's a good time to move... You can migrate your Home System to another special node. To do so, you need to prepare yourself by hacking a special node and placing a Beacon.
Migration

Yay, you got a #FFFFFF#Beacon#REVERT#! It will grant your Home System a nice portion of its bonuses. You can either migrate immediately (and lose a high percentage of your Population & Improvements) or wait a few turns for a safe migration. The longer you wait, the safer the migration (and the lower your losses).

If your Home System had previously been detected, the migration makes it invisible again. There are three ways a Beacon can be removed: by hand, after a migration, or after trying to migrate to an already occupied special node.
Sanctuary cohabitation
Hey, someone's got a Colony in your Sanctuary System. #FFFF00#Let’s have a look#REVERT#!
Sanctuary cohabitation

As you can see, both of you can cohabit in peace. If the Colony’s owner is your ally and this System is invaded, your Sanctuary will automatically help defend themself by adding its manpower to the System.
See this #FFFFFF#nice button#REVERT#? You can use it to remove one population from your Sanctuary and immediately obtain a Sleeper on the Colony.
Umbral Shadows
You know what? You can get Umbral Shadow populations. They grant twice the bonuses of normal Umbral Choir populations, enjoy additional Bandwidth, but consume twice as much Food.

To get one, you must hack or invade a System with a Sleeper and select the Abduct outcome. This will remove the Sleeper population from the System and change one of the Umbral Choir populations in your Home System into a supercharged Umbral Shadow pop.
Sleeper
Congrats, you got a Sleeper. Switch to #FFFF00#scan View#REVERT# please.
Sleeper
Each Sleeper grants you vision on the System they are on, as well as bonus Bandwidth. If you reach #FFFFFF#the thresholds visible here#REVERT#, you can siphon the other Empire's resources too.
Sanctuary Link

Do you want to stay hidden despite building km-long ships? Do you want your next population to go to a Sanctuary? Make them all spawn on your Sanctuaries! Click on #FFFF00#this button#REVERT# to select the Sanctuary you wish to use as a spawn point.
Offensive Program
Congrats, you unlocked an Offensive Program! Switch to #FFFF00#Scan View#REVERT# please.
Offensive Program
Click on #FFFF00#the Offensive Program [offensiveProgram] button#REVERT# to get the list of available Offensive Programs.

You can place an Offensive Program on any colonized node you don't own (other major empires, minor empires, pirates) which is on the path of one of your Hacking Operations. The Program will influence the Operation when it reaches the node. This may help bypass your opponent's defences. Place them carefully, as you can't remove them once they're used by an ongoing Operation.
Cloaking

Hey, you know what? Your ships are natively Cloaked! To switch between being Cloaked or Uncloaked, use #FFFF00#this button#REVERT#. But keep in mind that this will consume all of your Fleet's remaining Movement Points.
Cloaking

You just changed the Cloaked status of your Fleet. A Cloaked fleet is ordinarily invisible to the other players. It can't guard a node, but won't be stopped by a Fleet guarding a node. It can even ignore Closed Borders… as long as it's not detected.

Cloaked fleets can be detected by Fleets with Anti-Cloaking modules. There are several levels of Cloaking/Anti-Cloaking, and you can improve by unlocking the corresponding technology. Stay vigilant, as a Ship with a powerful enough Anti-Cloaking module can even uncover your Home System if on the node.
Trace
Something is happening in Scan View, #FFFF00#let’s have a look#REVERT#!
Trace

Oh, look, a #FFFFFF#Security Breach#REVERT#! It happens when a hack reaches a node where there is a Defensive Program. A trace (a counter-hack) starts from the Security Breach, and traces back the hack. If the trace reaches the origin of the hack, the hack is canceled, and a detrimental effect may be applied to the hacker. Important stuff to keep in mind: a trace is faster than a hack.
Hacked Off

One of your systems has just been hacked! Who could have done that? Well… Pretty much anyone, actually. A Major Faction, a Minor Faction, or even a Pirate Lair. And as you may have guessed, depending on who hacked your system, the outcome may be different. Maybe you should use some Defensive Programs to protect your systems.
Traced!

An enemy Trace reached the origin of your Hacking Operation and cancelled it. The shortest way is also the riskiest! It is sometimes better to take a longer, less direct path, so that the Trace takes longer to work its way back to the origin.
Hacking

Did you ever wonder what you could do with all the computational power you have on your systems? Well, one of your engineers has the answer: use them to hack your opponents! Switch to #FFFF00#Scan View#REVERT# to learn more about hacking.
Cloaking and Anti-Cloaking
With the right module, it is possible to Cloak a Fleet. And with the right module, it is also possible to detect Cloaked Fleets. Life's like that.

You can get access to these modules by unlocking the corresponding Technology in the Military Quadrant. Keep in mind that there are multiple levels of Cloaking, and therefore multiple levels of Anti-Cloaking detection tech.
Umbral Shadows
As the Umbral Choir, getting Sleepers is especially important for the evolution of your population. Like… literally.

Once you have a Sleeper on someone else's System you will be able to abduct them, where synthesis with an ordinary Umbral Choir population will result in an improved, hybrid population: an Umbral Shadow!
Generate $AmountAltLoc [prestigeColored] per [turn] in one of your Systems.
To take control of a System, you must create a Sanctuary on it.
Take control of the $QuestSystemName System
The higher the trade income, the faster the Trading Companies level up.
Possess a Level $Amount03Name Trading Company
Possess at least $MinSystemAmountAltName Systems of Level $MinLevelAmountName or higher.
Raise $Amount04Name Systems to Level $Amount02Name.
Possess a Level $Amount03Name Trading Company
Reach at least Level $Amount06Name on your Home System
Always be sure to have at least one active Transmigration Beacon. You never know when an enemy fleet may come knocking!
As the Umbral Choir, all your ships are naturally Cloaked. Even the ones you buy on the Marketplace!
The more Planets on a System where you have a Sanctuary, the more difficult it is to detect for your enemies.
Your Sanctuaries will help your allies in their Ground Battles. Being the Umbral Choir and being a pal are not incompatible!
Any Backdoor you place will grant you a small Hacking Speed bonus when Hacking through this node.
Starting a Hacking Op from a Backdoor will never trigger a security breach. This does not mean there are no Defensive Programs on the node though!
Unallocated Bandwidth will grant you a small Hacking Speed bonus.
Hacking a Home System yields much better outcomes than a regular System. Don't forget to defend yours appropriately!
You have lost your Home System; unless you reclaim it you will be defeated in 4 turns.
