Nexus

The Umbral Choir are outsiders to the Endless galaxy, and Nexus is their hidden fortress from where they explore this new realm. As immaterial wraiths capable of infiltrating the logical foundations of machine and cybernetic systems, the Umbral Choir are masters of espionage, but, equally, are unable to colonize worlds by traditional methods. Nexus is their answer to this conundrum. A medley of constructed interlocking rings, this artificial world acts as a bridge between the material and immaterial domains, permitting the Choir to fulfil their ambitions of ending the suffering in the galaxy.
Creature, we are unalike, but perhaps there is still an opportunity for trade?
We have been watching you, proximate Creature, and we believe you wish to end suffering too.
The Choir finds your gesture pleasing.
The Choir's outlook on certain other creatures of this galaxy seems in harmony with your own. This is pleasing.
The Choir noticed your hostile actions against our enemy. How unfortunate--for them. Please carry on.
Creature, the Choir's need for Dust is much greater than your own. Donate, or we must take it.
What an unpleasant creature you are. We will remember your hostilities.
The Choir feels the pain you inflict on every last echo. Please relent.
The Choir is not ready for uninvited guests in our corner of the galaxy. Please leave.
Creature, we watch your military vessels trespass in our space. Withdraw them. Now.
Creature, that system you just colonized adjoins Umbral Choir space. It was not yours to take. Do not repeat.
The Choir reverberates with disappointment. Why did you build an outpost right next to us?
Creature, the Choir welcomes the chance to watch you more closely, now that you possess an outpost in the next system.
Did you forget the Choir watches its territory closely? The presence of your military ships is atonal.
The Choir finds your demand outrageous, disrespectful, arrogant, but most of all, unforgiveable.
Creature, our mission is to end the galaxy's suffering. Sometimes this requires that we increase it, briefly.
The Choir is united in its belief that now is the time for you and us to create a deeper peace. A chord.
With your unexpected attack during harmonious relations, the Choir learned a painful lesson. This will be a song for the ages.
Creature, you sow discord, where the Choir seeks only harmony. Where are we to expand, now that you have colonized a node that cuts us off from the rest of the galaxy?
The Choir finds your demand most distasteful. Maybe the differences in our fundamental natures made true friendship impossible, Creature?
Every strain of the Choir welcomes the opening of borders between us. No more surreptitious eavesdropping!
Your generous gift is most appreciated, Creature. The Choir will focus its attention elsewhere--for now.
Creature, as you stand in the way of our plans for ending this galaxy's suffering, your suffering must increase. We are at war.
Creature, the Choir agitates at a thousand frequencies over your belligerent displays. Our borders are closed.
The Choir watches you closely, Creature, but sees no signs of hostility. Perhaps we judged you too quickly.
A wise choice, Creature. You will learn the Choir is a force for peace.
The Choir is fascinated by this galaxy's political games. The 'gift' is well recieved.
The Choir welcomes your peaceful outlook, Creature. Our future resonates harmonious.
You will do well to heed our future ultimatums too, Creature.
Sometimes the Choir is forced to end suffering in a most primitive way. You only have yourself to blame, Creature.
Because you ignore our words, the Choir resonates with many sad and angry strains. Soon we will strike from the shadows.
Creature, this second colony belies your expansionist plans. The Choir will not tolerate this.
Creature, your trespass of Umbral Choir space has gone on too long. We will no longer watch with impunity.
You colonize too close to the Choir. Do you really want us so near, Creature? Remember we are masters of deception and infiltration.
The Choir wishes for a time of quiet reflection. We are closing our borders.
Creature, we are weary of the presence of your military vessels in our territories. Desist. Now.
We feel your pain, Creature. But attacking the Choir is not the path to harmony.
The Choir is not some grubby creature you can buy with mere trinkets. We have principles.
You disappoint the Choir, Creature. The peace we shared was precious, and now you declare war on us?
The Choir is intrigued by this galaxy. Perhaps we can share knowledge, and both benefit?
The Choir understands that trade is a great engine of progress in this galaxy. Perhaps we can trade, Creature?
The Choir sings from the same hymn sheet. We will propose a trade agreement soon.
Creature, the extended peace between us gives us great hope for our future in this galaxy.
Isn't it strange, Creature; how an immaterial outsider who hides in the shadows could get so much from mere trade?
Our mutual science agreement has given the Choir many insights into life in this galaxy. Thank-you, Creature.
You know, Creature, every time you make a demand of a friend you cause needless pain to arise.
The Choir admits to some inner discord regarding your military fleets in our territory. Should we be concerned?
The Choir offers a thousand strains of gratitude for heeding our concerns.
The Choir watched your clumsy trespass with a mixture of admiration and disgust. We will seek colder relations, Creature.
The Choir will remain unsettled until your fleets leave our space. Please rectify.
The Choir struggles to understand how you can expect your demand to be met without some incentive?
Creature, it appears we need to return to colder relations. Your continued intrusions, ignoring our pleas, cannot go unchallenged.
The Choir welcomes the removal of your military forces from our territory.
The Choir is saddened you failed to make any positive gesture, Creature. Expect our relations to grow colder.
The Choir feels somewhat relieved by your gesture, Creature, despite your earlier behavior.
Creature, a gulf still separates us, but we are losing a war and need an ally. Will you ease our suffering?
Other alliances in the galaxy grow, Creature. Maybe it is time we overcome our differences and find common cause.
Friend, the Choir undertakes a difficult war and sings a fractured song. As an alliance, though, we might overcome our enemy and find harmony.
Creature, others in this galaxy are forming alliances that could lead to more pain. The Choir is considering our own alliance to counter this threat.
We watch the galaxy diligently, and it hasn't escaped the Choir's eyes that we share an enemy. An alliance could ease much suffering…
Creature, the Choir has long enjoyed this era of peace between us. Soon we will propose an alliance to strengthen this peace.
Creature, we seem to share common aims for this galaxy. An alliance would make sense to see us both victorious.
Friend, in our time of need the Choir calls on our ally to offer their military might to our difficult war.
The Choir can't help but notice that you're under attack, friend. Our vessels are mobilizing in order to help.
Creature, we understand the sacrifices you've made being an ally of the Choir. Please accept this gift in thanks.
We came to this galaxy as outsiders, but our long alliance has made us feel most welcome. For your kindness, Creature, a fine gift.
Creature, the Choir reverberates with sad refrains at your crude demands. Our alliance will soon be over.
Creature, a demand is a most strange refrain to play, given that we're allies.
The Choir still remembers the pain you inflicted, Creature, but this gift helps dampen those refrains.
Creature, a gift as inadequate as this only sharpens the pain you caused the Choir.
Maybe the Choir is foolish to overlook your apathy, Creature, but we still hope you will become a better ally in time.
The Choir wonders about the utility of such a gesture so late in the day. Are we truly allies?
Friend, the Choir is still in need. Will you continue to ignore our pleas?
Creature, it staggers the Choir that we might lose a system to your empire, but what most pains us is your lack of reparations. We agitate to leave this alliance.
We are most disappointed you, an ally, would take one of our systems, even peacefully. Discord grows; our departure from this alliance is imminent.
The Choir seeks to reach--and heal--all manner of life. We offer you our gratitude for awakening this Guardian, Creature.
The Choir finds these tendrils a fascinating--and welcome--curiosity. Please continue, Creature.
Creature, can't you see the Choir wages war elsewhere? We will end your suffering later.
The harmony of the spheres demand that the Choir intrude into your sovereign space, Creature.
Creature, your war sends discordant harmonies across the galaxy--refrains that must be made agreeable by force of war.
Creature, your blockade is an affront against harmony. Desist, or the Choir will respond.
You attack unarmed vessels? The screams of the innocent will echo through the ages, monstrous Creature.
The Choir reverberates with dissonant refrains, knowing the monster you have awoken in our midst.
The Choir wails for its sibling echoes cruelly ended by your destruction of our world. At least they no longer suffer.
Time, the eternal riddle, no, Creature? The Choir offers its gratitude in any case.
Creature, your temporal actions against our system condemn us to vicissitudes. Why?
The Choir is unsettled by your cultural assimilation of one of our systems. Disharmony threatens if you persist.
Creature, you have ignored the Choir's instruction not to meddle in our cultural affairs. We seek to end this peace.
The Choir offers songs of appreciation for stopping your program of cultural assimilation, Creature.
The propitious singularity is unexpected given our current relations, but no less welcome for it. The Choir offers gratitude.
Creature, given our relations, this hostile temporal anomaly can only be interpreted as a prelude to war. We watch you, even more closely.
The Choir watches your blockade of our system with great dismay. Consequences loom.
Creature, the cosmos will know your abominable act of planetary annihiliation. Justice awaits.
You forget the the Choir watches all, Creature. The winner of the outpost race was never in doubt.
What sorcery is this? The Choir was certain we'd win the outpost race…
The Choir watches, but doesn't observe any movement to give us our requested tribute. Discord grows…
The Choir notes your fleets amassing at our borders, Creature. We hope they don't stray any further…
The Choir prostrates itself in recognition of your superiority, noble Creature. Please spare us further pain.
Creature, the Choir watches your movements with some trepidation. In response, we close our borders, seeking solitude.
Creature, our animosity towards you grows. The Choir watches, echoing with intent.
Creature, the Choir's mission to end the galaxy's suffering will soon bring us through your realm. Do not be afraid.
Such devastation! The Choir believes there are many other paths to peace, beyond mindless destruction.
These destructive appetites risk the harmony of the galaxy, Creature. Will the Choir be next?
The Choir will never sanction the obliteration of worlds, whatever the ends. We are considering ending this peace…
Creature, the Choir had understood that the acceptance of your demands would avoid a declaration of war.
The Choir is confused by this imposition of peace, but we welcome the chance of greater harmony.
The Choir welcomes peace, Creature. We give our gratitude for your action.
Peace? What game are you playing, Creature? The Choir watches--and will not be fooled.
The Choir continues to watch you closely, Creature, but this period of peace is promoting harmony within.
This false peace is not a path to end suffering, Creature. The Choir seeks to break this union.
The Choir seeks a sign of good faith coming into these negotiations for peace, Creature. A gift.
The Choir offers thanks for the gift. A lasting peace is within our grasp, Creature.
Your lack of a gift causes disharmony, Creature. This peace is ever so fragile…
Creature, the end to your suffering will not be found in peace, but war.
Creature, let the Choir be candid: we resound with hatred for you, and want no more contact.
The Choir feels sorry for the religious fanaticism that drives you to such hostile acts, Creature. We will find no joy in repelling your attacks.
Creature, your conversion of our system has not gone unnoticed. The Choir will seek restitution.
Creature, our common understanding of the state peace is not aligned if you think converting one of the Choir's systems is acceptable. The Choir declares war.
Creature, our alliance is finished. Your brazen theft of our system can only have one response: war.
The Choir mourns for all its lost echoes, silenced in your heinous obliteration. We muster for war.
Creature, obliterating any world in this galaxy is a most grevious sin. Understand, the Choir will do everything in its power to stop further wanton destruction.
It is a sad day when the only means of easing suffering is to obliterate systems in their entirety. The Choir wonders if immaterial beings are next...
The Choir cannot watch and do nothing while you destroy our allies' systems. Soon you will open another front in your war.
There is a cold logic in bringing an end to suffering through annihilation. The Choir is happy you target a mutual enemy.
Creature, we are at war, but your obliteration of an entire one of our systems sends a wail across the cosmos that will never be forgotten.
Creature, how can we be at peace if you destroy one of my ally's systems? Ready yourself for war.
Tell me, Creature, in what multiverse is it acceptable to destroy an ally's system? War is coming.
Creature, you have a strange concept of an alliance if you destroy an ally's system. The Choir moves to leave.
Honor is a strange concept for the Choir, but we must declare war in its name nonetheless.
The Choir seeks peace, but doesn't look kindly to being forced into anything.
Your fleets trespass in the Choir's territory, Creature. Remove them. Immediately.
Your colonies that border our territory cause disharmony, Creature. The Choir awaits their hasty removal.
The Choir watches your attacks on our fleets and systems with great misgivings, Creature. Desist. Now.
Creature, even the peaceful capture of the Choir's systems is an act of aggression. Stop. Immediately.
The echoes and shadows of the Choir are not your feeding grounds, Creature. Desist.
Creature, your temporal interferences in the Choir's systems are not welcome. Stop.
Your grasping vines in the Choir's systems cause discord, Creature. They need to be removed. Immediately.
The Choir is not ready for uninvited listeners in our corner of the galaxy. Please leave.
Greetings, Creature. The Choir comes to salve the galaxy's suffering.
The Choir has no wish to inflict more suffering. We offer a truce.
The Choir has no desire to crush you, and only wishes for harmony. We accept this truce.
Creature, the Choir recognises its losing position, and seeks a truce to regain harmony.
Creature, you make a magnanimous gesture. The Choir accepts the truce.
Creature, you sow discord in our peaceful relations. It is time for the Choir to acknowledge a colder status.
The Choir feels sadness that you end our period of peace, Creature.
Creature, this alliance is built on suspicion and discord. The Choir moves to Cold War relations.
The Choir has watched you abuse this alliance, Creature, and we are happy to establish a new Cold War.
The Choir can no longer pretend this truce is anything but a farce. For the sake of harmony, we move to war.
From truce to war? The creatures of this galaxy have a strange way of expressing themselves. So be it.
The Choir sees no way to end your suffering without taking up arms, Creature. We move to a real war.
War is certainly one means of ending suffering, Creature. The Choir hopes you find solace in this act.
It is with sadness that the Choir admits this peace was only creating disharmony within. It is time for war.
Creature, if this is the path you must travel, then we will not counsel against it. We shift from peace to war.
From the shadows the Choir has watched this alliance become a mockery of the word. We unleash our wraiths of war.
Creature, why is trust in such short supply in this galaxy? Know that your turn to war will not give you what you need.
Creature, you are a confused thing, aren't you? Please, let the Choir salve your suffering.
Creature, the Choir watches from the shadows and sees that we can enjoy happier relations. What do you say to Peace?
Granted. The Choir is always open to peaceful relations.
Do you forget we have eyes everywhere, Creature? Your offer of peace is insincere and the Choir refuses.
Do you forget we have eyes everywhere, Creature? Your offer of peace is insincere and the Choir refuses.
The Choir is in concordance on this matter; how do you feel about an Alliance, Creature?
Agreed. An Alliance with you, Creature, is in harmony with our wider aims of a galaxy absent of suffering.
I'm sorry, Creature. The idea of an Alliance gives many of the Choir's refrains an uneasy feeling. We refuse.
I'm sorry, Creature. The idea of an Alliance gives many of the Choir's refrains an uneasy feeling. We refuse.
Creature, we are most certain in our observations on this matter. We should strengthen our Peace and become an Alliance.
Let us make it official, Creature. To our Alliance.
With great respect, the Choir must decline. Peace is all we want at this time, Creature.
With great respect, the Choir must decline. Peace is all we want at this time, Creature.
The Choir is here to end all suffering, Creature. A small proposal to that end...
The Choir finds much harmony in this proposal. We accept.
Regrettably, the Choir only sees discord in this proposal. We remain open to other offers, of course.
Regrettably, the Choir only sees discord in this proposal. We remain open to other offers, of course.
What is the Umbral Choir to make of this? Nothing.
The Choir finds it necessary to impose this diplomatic treaty.
Creature, why do you impose your treaty upon the Choir? This is not a friendly act.
The Choir only seeks solace for all.
The Choir acknowledges your move, Creature. We watch on with great interest.
Creature, your strivings for harmony are an inspiration to the Umbral Choir. We salute you.
Creature, your kind words resonate within the Choir.
Creature, you are a discordant note in a galaxy striving for harmony.
We watch you closely, Creature. The Choir doesn't need your ugly words to know how you feel about us.
For the sake of the galaxy, the Choir has a demand.
The Choir hopes you will not regret making this demand, Creature.
The Choir is in harmony on this, Creature. We have no choice but to entreat for war.
If the Choir sees no other way ahead, then you will have your war, Creature.
The Choir possesses many things of value to trade, material or otherwise. We have a proposal, Creature.
Creature, with our goal of harmony for the galaxy, you will find the Choir a beneficial trading partner.
The Choir sees nothing in this trade agreement that it needs, Creature. We refuse.
The Choir sees nothing in this trade agreement that it needs, Creature. We refuse.
Creature, you will find the knowledge possessed by the Umbral Choir is a most valuable commodity.
Creature, this galaxy is full of miracles, and together our sciences will help us both understand them better.
The Choir declines this offer to share knowledge. We make great harmonies in the sciences alone.
The Choir declines this offer to share knowledge. We make great harmonies in the sciences alone.
If harmony must be found through war, the Choir will not shy away, Creature. Be ready for a brutal conflict.
The Choir watches your indecision with amusement, Creature. We recommence hostilities, then?
You may close your borders, Creature, but remember the Choir watches everywhere from the shadows.
Creature, you are quite logical to open your borders to the Umbral Choir. We commend you.
The Choir is not ready for the discordant sounds of outsiders in our space.
The Choir is not ready for the discordant sounds of outsiders in our space.
Creature, your clangorous sorties through our space forces the Choir to close borders.
The Choir wishes to open borders, Creature. Do not think we won't still be watching you carefully, though.
Strange, all the Choir hears is meaningless noise. In other words, Creature, we are ignoring you.
The Choir is always happy to hear from new creatures. We seek only harmony for all.
We are the Umbral Choir. Many refrains, one aim: the end of suffering.
Even though we watch from the shadows, many places in this galaxy remain unfamiliar to the Choir. We are happy to share maps.
The Choir does not share this lightly, blessed Creature. We have eyes everywhere.
Do you not like what you see with our eyes, Creature? Or are you afraid of what we might learn from your own?
Creature, did our trade lack the harmony you desired? The Choir is disappointed.
The Choir believes your understanding of nature will suffer for your cancelation of our science agreement. Do you seek ignorance?
Creature, the Choir watches from the shadows, but we cannot be everywhere. Let us share our vision.
Creature, the Choir seeks harmony for this galaxy, but the way you use our intelligence sows discord. You will no longer see what we do.
Creature, between our star charts and yours, we might witness the true majesty of this galaxy.
The Choir is borne of the darkest depths of the cosmos. We hold many secrets to its ultimate nature--secrets we are happy to exchange.
The Choir wants only accord; we embrace a truce.
The Choir are prepared to offer a truce for the sake of harmony.
The Choir is committed to see this conflict through to the end. We accept no truce, Creature.
The Choir is committed to see this conflict through to the end. We accept no truce, Creature.
Creature, do you think there is much of this galaxy the Choir doesn't see from the shadows? We don't need your maps.

Creature, the Choir feels a sharing of vision would be a poor exchange for us. We are everywhere.
Creature, the Choir feels a sharing of vision would be a poor exchange for us. We are everywhere.
Creature, the Choir seeks only harmony. We are prepared to make a co-operative protocol.
A pact well suits the Choir. We accept, Creature.
The Choir sees only chaos in this pact. Creature, we decline.
The Choir sees only chaos in this pact. Creature, we decline.
It is with somber refrains that I relay that this pact no longer serves the Choir.
Creature, you no longer think this pact leads to harmony in the galaxy?
The Choir renounces this alliance for the harmony of the galaxy.
Creature, the Choir found great solace in this alliance, but if you must renounce it...
Creature, a gift from the Choir...
We, the Choir, find deep comfort in your gift. Our gratitude, Creature.
Every creature should desire an existence filled with peace. We bring it to you. Rejoice.
Interstellar Wind Shields
A clever application of phased magnetic fields, this technology permits habitats to be constructed in regions experiencing high-radiation interstellar winds.
Supralight Aerodynamics

The physics of supralight speeds is no trifling matter, and calculating drag effects would test even ENFER's intelligence. Luckily, some bright spark invented this technology, allowing even faster ship speeds.
Anomaly Framework
A scientific framework for helping to research and theorize on anomalous phenomena, often leading to scientific or entrepreneurial gains.
Harmonized Shadows
Analogous to machine-translation software, this technology permits Umbral Shadows to communicate more effectively, especially related to recovering deeply embedded knowledge from prior lives.
Survival Training
You offer them the material goods they need, they teach you how to defend yourself. Win win. +100 [manPowerColored]

In the Shadows
Science\nBandwidth

An ancient immaterial creature from the depth of 
intergalactic space, the Umbral Choir roamed the cold,
 empty wastes, terribly alone until a great cry of 
anguish pierced the darkness. Shattering into a choir 
of echoes, the fractured creature sped towards the 
source of the space-and-time rending wail--the 
Endless galaxy--seeking to salve that which was in 
pain. Unbeknownst to the Umbral Choir, the cry 
marked the dying scream of the Endless civilization, 
and as it arrived, millenia later, new life was emerging
 from the remnants.
Pacifists\nScientists
The Umbral Choir is defeated; another empire is victorious.
Harmony has been brought to the galaxy! The Umbral Choir reigns supreme, its refrains of peace echoing across the stars.

Victory! The galaxy's suffering will soon be ended; the peace-loving permitted to live, the warmongers banished forever. Harmony will reign, and the Umbral Choir's refrains will echo across the stars unchallenged.
The Umbral Choir drift defeated, their vision for the galaxy shattered. Was their dream of a galaxy free from suffering an impossible task, or did the Choir stay in the shadows for too long?
Artificial Life
Maybe it is the combination of billions of precise factors, or maybe it is pure luck, but every attempt to create artificial life on this Crescent seems to succeed.
Dust Accretor
Large quantities of Dust can be found in the dark nooks of this Crescent, as some of the materials used in its construction seem to attract ambient Dust.
Flickering Matter

As a material construction created by an immaterial being, sometimes this Crescent flickers and loses its materiality for a few moments. Although this is fortuitous for the understanding of matter itself, it may not be such good news when what you are trying to build disappears unpredictably.
Flickering Matter
The matter still tends to flicker, but it is now possible to predict these changes rather accurately. No more spontaneous disappearance of ships from construction hangars.
Pseudo-Atmosphere
A pseudo-atmosphere appeared during the creation of this Crescent. The way light passes through it creates unique visuals, so fascinating that even the most scientific minds tend to become aesthetes.
Pseudo-Atmosphere
All it took was encouraging the study of the luminous phenomena of this pseudo-atmosphere for the inhabitants of this Crescent to regain their interest in science.
Low-Quality Foundations
The construction of this Crescent was hasty, and as a result, malfunctions are numerous and frequent.
Low-Quality Foundations
After long and tedious efforts, every defect in the Crescent has been fixed. These all too frequent malfunctions are now just a bad memory.
Uninhabitable Area

Corruption on the materials used to build a section of this Crescent made it completely uninhabitable. Although the impact is relatively minor, this deserted section remains a rather depressing symbol of failure.
Uninhabitable Area
The uninhabitable section of the Crescent has finally been reworked, everything is back to normal. If the Crescents were something normal in the first place.
